column4: What's a really lightweight yet powerful music player for GNOME?
It's the ultimate in lightweight "just do it all for me" music playback
Really? This is one of the least RAM-using players they have?
I really hafta get some 256MB RAM cards then -.-
there are some winamp copycats that are more lightweight
but rhythmbox automatically adds music to your library and such so it's less work to use
It does? I had to put it in myself...
BTW I love the global keyboard shortcuts.
For RhythmBox. Do they work on all music players?
those don't work with other players
well, except banshee and amarok but those are heavier than rhythmbox
Dangit! I might have to stick with RhythmBox then...
if you tell rhythmbox your music is in /home/user/Music and to watch it for changes it'll add the music for you if you drop it in the Music dir
That's odd, I can't select the drive as a folder?
